item.title: Report X-2024010436
item.description:
Report X-2024010436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA Hazmat Inspector Wolfe reported the TILX 306907 releasing an unknown amount of vapor. UP Hazmat responded to the car. Upon inspecting the car, the valve handles were able to be turned very slightly indicating they were in an open position. The valve plugs were impacted with several layers of old teflon tape and thread dope which prohibited the plugs from being fully engaged and secured. There was also old teflon debris inside of the valve body and threaded faceplate. The handles were all closed, and the plugs were removed and cleaned. The debris was also removed from the valve body. New teflon tape was applied to the threads and the plugs were secured tool tight.

item.title: Report X-2024020035
item.description:
Report X-2024020035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: LATHROP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO UNLOAD DOOR UPON ARRIVING RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE. UPON INSPECTING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER NOTICED A SMALL HOLE IN THE CORNER WHICH LED TO SOME OF THE ITEMS FALLING OUT BACK ONTO THE TOTE. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE TOTE, PLACED IT ON A PITO CART SAFE AND SECURED AFTER DOUBLE CHECKING TO SEE IF THEY LEFT ANYTHING BEHIND, RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO HEAD BACK TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND DISCUSS FURTHER ACTIONS WITH RMP

item.title: Report X-2024010733
item.description:
Report X-2024010733

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was been unloaded when it was realized that it was wet, an admin got called to retrieve the package around 5:00 AM, there was no other damage packages from the leak or any injuries.. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the gallons had a loss cap as well as the seal had been opened leading to the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Admin was quickly called for an inspection and retrieve the package with adequate equipment to put in an isolated area.

item.title: Report X-2024010732
item.description:
Report X-2024010732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment external packaging was dented on the two corners on its underside and emitted a strong sweetish chemical odor. It was subsequently removed from the sort stream and put into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: The dents were at the lower part of the cans , the accordioning indicative of compressive force applied from top down on the cans inside the external box .The liquid seeped from the body and underside edges of the can into the inner packaging surrounding it . DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The shipment was taken from the damage discovery site and put into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing. The excess liquid from the spill had been trapped by the plastic bags inside the outer box.

item.title: Report X-2024010377
item.description:
Report X-2024010377

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: IRVINE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED DURING SORT OPERATIONS. IT BEGAN SMOKING AFTER BEING UNLOADED FROM THE SHUTTLE. AFTER THE PACKAGE WAS SPRAYED WITH A FIRE EXTINGUISHER AND OPENED FOR INSPECTION, SMOKE, EMBERS AND FLAMES WERE VISIBLE. THE PACKAGE WAS ALLOWED TO COOL OF THEN PLACED IN A STEEL SALVAGE PACKAGE. THERE WERE 5 BATTERIES INSIDE THE UN4GV/X14/S/23/ROK/IDG045 BOX WITH CARDBOARD DIVIDERS AND STYROFOAM. THE RECIPIENT TOOK POSSESSION OF THE SHIPMENT BEFORE THE FAA COULD INVESTIGATE.

The boxes also contained various meat products (food stuff). The shipment will be held for pick up. Tracking Numbers: 774819564955, 774819494083, 774819543567, 774819555207, 774819494072, 774819513233, 774819505430, 774819469016, 774819540991, 774819480731, 774819523381, 774819492816, 774819493396, 774819756242 -

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat pkg was found at the end of trailer 561866 on its side unsecured and wet around 12:30am. Hazmat pkg was place in a line tote. QA was notify about the hazmat pkg and brought to the Hazmat cage for process. DescribePack: Upon inspection one out of the four bottles of Aqua balance muriatic acid cap was loose and spilled. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Damage hazmat was place in a line tote and brought to Hazmat cage for process.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The sample line valve had a liquid leak from the plug treads. The valve was open and plug was tool tight but did not create a seal. The valve was closed and plug was removed, new Teflon tape applied and then reinstalled, this stopped the release.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024010622
item.description:
Report X-2024010622

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE PREVIOUSLY DPR'D AND WASTE PRODUCTS SENT TO HMSA. GOODS FOUND TO BE REGULATED. SPIDR INDICATES THAT NO MARKINGS WERE ON OUTER CARTON. PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. VERY MINIMAL INTERNAL PACKAGING. NO PAINT CLIPS FOUND. DescribePack: BOTH CANS OF PAINT WITH DENTED BODIES AND LIDS OFF. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report I-2024100051
item.description:
Report I-2024100051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Fifteen minutes after departing from BOS, the customer observed their crossbody bag that they were wearing smelled strongly of the e-cigarette juice. Upon opening the zipper compartment holding the e-cigarette he saw the blue light on and was unable to switch it off. The customer immediately notified a Flight Attendant to assist with the situation. The Purser obtained the e-cigarette and utilized the fire containment bag. The crew maintained custody of the containment bag until arrival in LAX when it was tendered to the CSM who met the flight.

item.title: Report X-2024010618
item.description:
Report X-2024010618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found strapped onto 2 other hazmat's but only one box showed signs of leakage. It was underneath the NC rollers by the trailer door and was picked up with a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: The top flap of the box had a wet mark near where the cap of the bottle was located. Upon inner inspection the cap was found loose and the inner part of the top flaps was also wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spillage was not major and only the absorbent inside the red hazardous bin was used.

item.title: Report X-2023121083
item.description:
Report X-2023121083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-25
  • City: Roseville
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The sample line valve had a vapor leak at the valve plug, valve was in the closed position and plug was tool tight and did not create a seal. The valve is defective (seized) and leaking. The plug was removed, new Teflon tape was applied, and the plug was reinstalled. The valve at secondary securement is no longer leaking.
